<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;DOT Certification&#148; &nbsp;</B>means any and all certifications and approvals by the DOT, the FAA and other regulatory agencies required for SkyWest to operate the Aircraft and to perform pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and all Governmental Regulations.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Effective Date&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the date specified in the preamble to this Agreement.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>3</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always"><B>&#147;Excess Fuel Cost&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.05(c).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;FAA&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the Federal Aviation Administration or any successor organization.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Final Block Hour Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the payment for Block Hours calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.02(c)(ii)(A).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Final Cycle Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the payment for Cycles<B> </B>calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.02(c)(ii)(B).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">&#147;<B>Final Fixed Cost Payment</B>&#148; &nbsp;means the payment for fixed costs calculated in accordance with Section 5.02(c)(ii)(C).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Final Monthly Margin Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the payment calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.02(c)(ii)(D). </P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Fixed Cost Element&#148; &nbsp;</B>means a cost element specified on <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.04</U>.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Fixed Cost Rate&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.04 and <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.04</U>.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Fuel Burn Rate&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the quotient of (a) the total number of gallons of fuel burned by the Aircraft, including auxiliary power units, for a month, divided by (b) the total number of Block Hours for such month.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;GAAP&#148; &nbsp;</B>means generally accepted accounting practice and principles at the time prevailing in the United States for companies engaged in businesses similar to that of SkyWest, consistently applied.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Governmental Regulations&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the rules and regulations prescribed by an airport authority at a Service City or by any local, state or federal unit of government having authority and jurisdiction to regulate the business and affairs of an air carrier having DOT Certification, including without limitation, the DOT and the FAA.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Ground Handling Functions&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;4.02.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Hub Cities&#148; &nbsp;</B>means Milwaukee, Wisconsin (&#147;MKE&#148;), Kansas City, Missouri (&#147;MCI&#148;) and any other city in the United States where Midwest, together with its subsidiaries and Midwest Connect Carriers operating under Midwest&#146;s Designator, operate an average of more than twenty-five (25) departures per day during any Midwest Schedule Period.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Identification&#148; &nbsp;</B>means a trade name, trademark, service mark, graphic, logo, distinctive color scheme or other trade dress, domain name and/or other identification or indication of source or origin.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Initial Term&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such in term in Section 10.01.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>4</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always"><B>&#147;IOP Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the payment for IOP Program Incidents calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.03(c).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;IOP Program Incident&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall mean Midwest&#146;s request that SkyWest cancel one or more Scheduled Flights as a result of Midwest&#146;s initiation of its Irregular Operating Procedures Program.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:14.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>[*]</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Maintenance Facilities&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall mean the maintenance facilities described in Section 4.03(c).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;MASK&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;2.11(a).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in the preamble to this Agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest Connect Carrier&#148; &nbsp;</B>means an airline operating regional jet and/or turboprop air transportation services as a Midwest Connect carrier pursuant to an airline services agreement between such airline and Midwest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest Group&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;7.07.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest Guaranty&#148; &nbsp;</B>means that certain Guaranty executed by Midwest Air Group, Inc. in favor of SkyWest dated of even date herewith.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest Schedule Period&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the planned duration of various time periods for which Midwest&#146;s flight schedule is for sale in computer reservation systems.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest Service Cities&#148; &nbsp;</B>means those Service Cities at which Midwest employees perform substantially all Ground Handling Functions and Midwest provides required facilities, or a city at which Midwest has contracted directly with a third party other than SkyWest to provide those services and facilities.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Midwest Tickets&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;4.06(a).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Non-Scheduled Flights&#148; &nbsp;</B>means all flights using the Aircraft which are not Scheduled Flights or Charter Flights.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&nbsp;&#147;Pass-Through Expenses&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the expenses described on <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.06</U>.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Pass-Through Expense Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the payment for Pass-Through Expenses calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.02(c)(iii)(A). </P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Pass-Through Expense Report&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the report of Pass-Through Expenses to be prepared by SkyWest pursuant to Sections&nbsp;5.02(a)(iii) and 5.06.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Performance Criteria&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;5.08(a).</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>5</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always"><B>&#147;Performance Period&#148; &nbsp;</B>means each six (6) month period ending on a June&nbsp;30 or December&nbsp;31 occurring during the term of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Person&#148; &nbsp;</B>means an individual, partnership, corporation, business trust, joint stock company, limited liability company, unincorporated association, joint venture or other entity of whatever nature.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Planned Fuel Burn Rate&#148; &nbsp;</B>means <B>[*]</B> gallons per Block Hour.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Prohibited Change of Control&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the acquisition, directly or indirectly, by any Person or group of Persons reasonably deemed by Midwest to be a major competitor of Midwest or any of its Affiliates, in any one transaction or a series of related transactions, of (a) the right to control the direction of the management and policies of SkyWest, directly or indirectly, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise, or (b) ownership of (i) fifty percent (50%) or more of the outstanding equity securities of SkyWest, or (ii) all or substantially all of the assets of SkyWest. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Provisional Block Hour Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the amount set forth in Section 5.02(c)(i)(A).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Provisional Cycle Payment&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the amount set forth in Section 5.02(c)(i)(B).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">&#147;<B>Provisional Fixed Cost Payment</B>&#148; &nbsp;means the amount set forth in Section 5.02(c)(i)(C).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Provisional Monthly Margin Payment&#148;</B> means the amount set forth in Section 5.02(c)(i)(D)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Regional Airline Services&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the provisioning by SkyWest to Midwest of Scheduled Flights, Non-Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights using the Aircraft in accordance with this Agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Renewal Term&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;10.01.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Scheduled Flights&#148; &nbsp;</B>means revenue passenger flights (other than Charter Flights) using the Aircraft which, regardless of frequency, are held out to the public and published in the customary and applicable schedule distribution systems, such as the Official Airline Guide, or published by Midwest in its own system timetables. &nbsp;In addition, Scheduled Flights shall include all regularly scheduled flights which are not revenue passenger flights as determined by Midwest in its sole discretion.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Service Cities&#148; &nbsp;</B>means those cities identified from time to time by Midwest to which SkyWest shall provide Regional Airline Services.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;SkyWest&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in the preamble to this Agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;SkyWest Guaranty&#148; &nbsp;</B>means that certain Guaranty executed by SkyWest, Inc. in favor of Midwest dated of even date herewith.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>6</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always"><B>&#147;SkyWest Identification&#148; &nbsp;</B>means any Identification selected by SkyWest from time to time for use in connection with the business of SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;SkyWest Service Cities&#148; &nbsp;</B>means those Service Cities at which SkyWest employees perform substantially all Ground Handling Functions and SkyWest provides required facilities.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;TAR&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;2.11(a).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Ticket Taxes and Fees&#148; &nbsp;</B>means any taxes pursuant to Sections 4261 or 4271 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended or succeeded, on any amounts paid by customers for transportation of persons or packages by air, and any passenger facility charges, airport improvement fees, security fees or charges, stamp taxes, excise taxes, value-added taxes (in the nature of a sales or use tax), gross receipts taxes (in the nature of a sales or use tax), U.S. APHIS user fees, U.S. Customs user fees, U.S. Immigration user fees, and any other taxes and/or user fees imposed by any domestic or foreign governmental entity, airport or taxing authority on a per-passenger basis on any amounts paid by customers for transportation of persons or packages by air.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;Ticketing Services&#148; &nbsp;</B>means the ticketing services to be performed pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.06(a).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;YX Indemnitees&#148; &nbsp;</B>shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in Section&nbsp;8.02(b).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>&#147;YX Identification&#148; &nbsp;</B>means any Identification specifically selected by Midwest from time to time in its sole discretion for use by SkyWest in connection with the Regional Airline Services (including without limitation &#147;Midwest Connect&#148; or any similar name).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px" align=center><B>ARTICLE II<BR>
<BR>
<A NAME="_Toc159994745"></A>PROVISION OF REGIONAL AIRLINE SERVICES</B></P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994746"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.01</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Operation of Scheduled Flights</U></B>. &nbsp;Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, SkyWest shall use the Aircraft to operate Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights as shall be designated by Midwest from time to time in Midwest&#146;s sole discretion. &nbsp;All schedules and aircraft routing for such Scheduled Flights and all utilization of the Aircraft shall be determined by Midwest from time to time, in its sole discretion, subject to the reasonable operational constraints of SkyWest taking into consideration reasonable maintenance, crew training and Aircraft rotation requirements. &nbsp;Scheduled block times shall be set in accordance with Midwest&#146;s standards unless otherwise mutually agreed by Midwest and SkyWest. &nbsp;Minimum turn times shall be mutually agreed to by SkyWest and Midwest and set in conformity with standard industry practices and Aircraft type.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994747"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.02</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Use of Designator, YX Identification and Related Matters</U></B>. &nbsp;Subject to the applicable provisions of Article VII, below, SkyWest shall operate the Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights provided under this Agreement using the Designator. &nbsp;The Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights shall be identified by SkyWest solely with flight numbers assigned by Midwest. &nbsp;Subject to the applicable provisions of this Article II, SkyWest shall use only the YX Identification for the Aircraft (except as otherwise required by Governmental Regulations), and </P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>7</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">for all exclusive-use facilities (including Maintenance Facilities), signage, equipment and advertising, promotional and business materials in any form or media that are used in connection with the Regional Airline Services, and shall conform to Midwest standards for logo and brand as determined by Midwest. &nbsp;SkyWest shall not use the SkyWest Identification or the Identification of any other airline for the Aircraft (except as required by Governmental Regulation), exclusive-use facilities (including Maintenance Facilities), signage, equipment, uniforms or advertising, promotional or business materials in any form or media that are used in connection with the Regional Airline Services; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, nothing in the foregoing prohibition shall preclude SkyWest from using the SkyWest Identification for general corporate purposes, investor relations, on crew wings and employee servi
ce pins, and for purposes that are not covered by the foregoing prohibition and do not involve interaction with Midwest customers or passengers. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall agree on the color and design of all uniforms worn by SkyWest personnel involved in the provision of the Regional Airline Services. &nbsp;In the case of joint-use facilities, such as airport facilities where SkyWest provides ground handling services for Midwest and another carrier(s), Midwest and SkyWest shall agree on the appropriate use of YX Identification along with that of the other carrier(s).</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994748"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.03</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Use of Other Designators</U></B>. &nbsp;SkyWest shall not use on the Aircraft the airline designator, Identification, or any other identifying feature of a foreign or United States airline other than Midwest, without the express prior written consent of Midwest, or unless Midwest directs SkyWest to use such other designator, Identification, or identifying feature.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994749"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.04</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Personnel and Dispatch Control</U></B>. &nbsp;SkyWest shall be responsible for providing all crews (flight and cabin) to operate the Scheduled Flights, Non-Scheduled Flights and any Charter Flights and for all aspects (personnel and other) of dispatch control, including but not limited to load control. &nbsp;SkyWest dispatch control shall maintain frequent communication with Midwest dispatch control, and other Midwest entities as appropriate, to ensure the safe and timely operation of flights and to adhere to Midwest customer service standards.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994750"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.05</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Inventory Management</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest shall have complete control over all inventory management functions for all Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights operated pursuant to this Agreement, including, without limitation, overbooking levels, discount seat levels, itinerary controls and allocation of seats among the various fare buckets. &nbsp;In performing SkyWest&#146;s inventory management, Midwest shall conform in all material respects to its own procedures and standards, taking into account the type of Aircraft operated by SkyWest.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994751"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.06</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Passenger Fares</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest shall be the sole authority for filing tariffs for Scheduled Flights operated pursuant to this Agreement, and Midwest shall establish all passenger fares for Scheduled Flights and rates for Charter Flights operated pursuant to this Agreement. &nbsp;All charges for filing of fares or tariffs for Scheduled Flights operated pursuant to this Agreement shall be paid by Midwest.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994752"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.07</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>DOT Certification</U></B>. &nbsp;SkyWest has and shall maintain DOT Certification and all other permits, licenses, certificates and insurance required by governmental authorities and Article IX hereof to enable SkyWest to perform the services required by this Agreement.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994753"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>8</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always"><B>2.08</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Compliance With Governmental Regulations</U></B>. &nbsp;All flight operations, dispatch operations and flights and all other operations undertaken by SkyWest pursuant to this Agreement shall be conducted and operated by SkyWest in strict compliance with all Governmental Regulations, including, without limitation, those relating to airport security, the use and transportation of hazardous materials, flight crew and mechanic qualifications and licensing requirements, crew training and hours. &nbsp;All Aircraft shall be operated and maintained by SkyWest in strict compliance with all Governmental Regulations, SkyWest&#146;s own operations manuals and maintenance manuals and procedures, and all applicable equipment manufacturers&#146; instructions. &nbsp;At all times, SkyWest shall operate with the highest standards of care.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994754"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.09</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Quality of Service</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest policies, procedures, performance standards and means of measurement thereof concerning the provision of air passenger and air cargo services shall be applicable to all services provided by SkyWest under this Agreement. &nbsp;SkyWest shall achieve at least the same quality of airline service provided by Midwest, subject to limitations imposed by the type of Aircraft used by SkyWest, its route network, the availability of equipment and facilities at the Service Cities and the performance by Midwest of its obligations under this Agreement. &nbsp;SkyWest shall maintain adequate staffing levels to ensure at least the same level of customer service and operational efficiency that Midwest achieves; SkyWest shall cooperate with Midwest in any way necessary or desirable to provide such comparable level of customer service in connection with the operation of Regional Ai
rline Services; and SkyWest shall maintain new hire and recurrent training programs for all job descriptions which are reasonably acceptable to Midwest.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994755"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.10</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Service Standards</U></B>. &nbsp;[*]</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Minimum Completion Factor</U>. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Minimum On Time Reliability</U>. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B> </P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Mishandled Luggage Factor</U>. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Customer Complaints Factor</U>. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(e)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Care Check Score</U>. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(f)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Customer Experience Pulse</U>. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(g)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Calculations</U>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:192px; font-size:16px"><B>[*]</B></P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994756"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.11</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Service Recovery</U></B>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Passenger Amenities</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest agrees to provide passenger amenities, including, without limitation, denied boarding compensation, which Midwest provides under Rule 245 of the Domestic General Rules No.&nbsp;1 issued by Airline Tariff Publishing Co. and ATA Resolution No.&nbsp;120.20 or pursuant to any similar contractual arrangement now existing or hereafter in effect or applicable to Midwest. &nbsp;In any SkyWest Service City or Contracted Service City, SkyWest agrees (i) to handle oversold Scheduled Flights and the payment of denied boarding compensation in accordance with Midwest&#146;s standard policies and procedures, (ii) to pay the full </P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>9</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">cost of providing passenger amenities (either directly to the affected passengers or to Midwest as reimbursement for the amounts paid by Midwest to such passengers) with the exception of denied boarding compensation resulting from inventory oversales or other actions of Midwest, and (iii) to report all denied boarding data to Midwest via both the standard Midwest Ticket Agent Report (&#147;TAR&#148;) and the standard Midwest Yield Management Flight Close-Out Denied Boarding Mask (&#147;MASK&#148;). &nbsp;In any SkyWest Service City or Contracted Service City, for denied boarding compensation resulting from inventory oversales or the actions of Midwest, SkyWest will pay the appropriate amount of denied boarding compensation to the affected passengers and will invoice Midwest for such amount pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.07, below. &nbsp;Any such invoice will include sufficient detail and supporting docum
entation to allow Midwest to verify the invoiced amount. &nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, SkyWest shall be responsible for any discrepancy between the TAR and the MASK, and Midwest will invoice SkyWest for any amounts due based on reconciliation of those two reports. &nbsp;In Midwest Service Cities, Midwest will provide all passenger amenities, including but not limited to baggage delivery, at its sole cost.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Destination by other Means</U>. &nbsp;If SkyWest transports a revenue passenger to his or her destination by another means (bus, train, taxi, etc.) due to a flight cancellation, Midwest shall reimburse SkyWest for the actual transportation costs incurred to transport the passenger by such other means. &nbsp;SkyWest shall use its best efforts to minimize the transportation of passengers by other means and the costs associated therewith. &nbsp;SkyWest must confer with designated Midwest customer service staff prior to making arrangements of this type.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994757"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.12</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Inflight Food, Beverages and Supplies</U></B>. &nbsp;Unless otherwise mutually agreed, Midwest will provide Aircraft catering services and food and beverages for passengers on Scheduled Flights in accordance with Midwest&#146;s specifications and directions and at Midwest&#146;s sole cost. &nbsp;SkyWest shall be solely responsible for maintaining all licenses necessary for the serving of inflight food and beverages on Scheduled Flights and for the provision of crew meals. &nbsp;If so desired, Midwest will supply crew meals as directed by SkyWest, and shall invoice to SkyWest the actual cost of the crew meals so supplied. &nbsp;Midwest shall furnish SkyWest, at Midwest&#146;s sole cost, adequate supplies of its customary inflight supplies including, but not limited to, the Midwest inflight magazine, cups, napkins, pillows, blankets, trash bags, sick sacks, lavatory supplies, creamers, swizzle sticks and
 sugar in a form similar to or identical with that used by Midwest. &nbsp;SkyWest may be asked to administer Midwest&#146;s buy-on-board meal program on designated flights. &nbsp;In this case, SkyWest personnel shall be trained in all Midwest catering and sales procedures by Midwest and shall utilize all associated equipment and procedures designated by Midwest for the buy-on-board meal program.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994758"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>2.13</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Exclusivity Arrangements</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest agree that this Agreement shall not prevent either party from engaging in other similar arrangements or agreements with other carriers, except that the Aircraft are for the exclusive use of Midwest as provided in Section&nbsp;3.01. &nbsp;Nothing in this Agreement shall preclude Midwest from (i) entering into code share, alliance or other commercial cooperation arrangements with any other airline, or (ii) entering into similar or other arrangements with other carriers for the provisioning of regional airline services using Canadair Regional Jets, other regional jets, turboprop aircraft or any other aircraft to or from the Hub Cities, the same Service Cities or elsewhere.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px" align=center><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>10</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always" align=center><B>ARTICLE III<BR>
<BR>
<A NAME="_Toc159994759"></A>AIRCRAFT</B></P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994760"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>3.01</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Use of the Aircraft</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest agree that (a) the Aircraft shall be used only to provide and/or support the Regional Airline Services contemplated by this Agreement, (b) the Aircraft shall not be used by SkyWest for any other purpose without the prior written consent of Midwest, and (c) the Regional Airline Services shall be provided only using the Aircraft; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that SkyWest may, from time to time as maintenance needs may require, use a neutrally-painted Bombardier CRJ-200 aircraft (which is not an Aircraft for purposes of this Agreement) to provide Regional Airlines Services hereunder.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994761"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>3.02</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Fleet Size and Related Matters</U></B>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Initial Fleet Size</U>. &nbsp;The initial fleet shall consist of fifteen (15) Aircraft, one of which shall constitute an operational spare. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall mutually agree on the timing and rate of deployment of the initial fleet. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Fleet Additions</U>. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest agree that, subject to availability of aircraft on economic terms acceptable to Midwest and SkyWest, SkyWest will, at the written request of Midwest, procure, prepare, and put into service up to ten (10) additional Aircraft on the same terms and conditions as apply to the initial fleet of fifteen (15) Aircraft. &nbsp;This obligation shall be applicable only until the second anniversary of the Effective Date of this Agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Induction and Termination Costs</U>. &nbsp;All one-time expenses that are associated with inducting Aircraft and making them ready for use pursuant to this Agreement shall be paid one hundred percent (100%) by SkyWest. &nbsp;<B>[*]</B> &nbsp;In addition, Midwest shall reimburse SkyWest for the cost of installing leather seat covers on the Aircraft. &nbsp;All return costs and expenses associated with the return of Aircraft shall be paid one hundred percent (100%) by SkyWest without reimbursement by Midwest. &nbsp;Midwest&#146;s obligation to reimburse SkyWest for certain expenses hereunder is subject to the provisions of Section 5.02(e), below.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px" align=center><B>ARTICLE IV<BR>
<BR>
<A NAME="_Toc159994762"></A>ANCILLARY ARRANGEMENTS</B></P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994763"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.01</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Coordination with SkyWest</U></B>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Schedules and Timetables</U>. &nbsp;Midwest shall file and maintain schedules with all applicable schedule distribution systems for all Scheduled Flights, and such schedules shall be filed and maintained by Midwest together with the schedules for its flights. &nbsp;Midwest shall include and list all Scheduled Flights providing Regional Airline Services in the schedule publication program of Midwest. &nbsp;SkyWest shall conform in all respects to Midwest&#146;s use of electronic schedules, timetables and contracts of carriage. &nbsp;Midwest shall include Scheduled Flights operated by SkyWest in all appropriate flight information systems on which Midwest flights are listed.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>11</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Travel Privileges</U>. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall each be entitled to make available for their respective employees and members of their respective Boards of Directors, those travel privileges as mutually agreed to by the parties.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994764"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.02</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Ground Handling</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest reserves the right to designate the ground handler at all locations served by SkyWest pursuant to this Agreement. &nbsp;At cities designated by Midwest as Midwest Service Cities, Midwest or its designated contractor shall provide the following functions: &nbsp;(a) all gate and ticket counter check-in activities, (b) all passenger enplaning/deplaning services, including but not limited to sky cap and wheel chair services, (c) aircraft loading/unloading services, including but not limited to airside busing, (d) passenger ticketing, (e) aircraft cleaning, including but not limited to overnight cleaning, (f) jetbridge maintenance (where applicable), (g) janitorial services, and (h) deicing services (collectively, the &#147;Ground Handling Functions&#148;) at no charge to SkyWest. &nbsp;At cities jointly designated by Midwest and SkyWest as SkyWest Service Cities, SkyW
est shall provide the Ground Handling Functions. &nbsp;At mutually agreeable Contracted Service Cities, SkyWest shall provide the Ground Handling Functions utilizing a contract agent. &nbsp;Should a city be designated as a SkyWest Service City or a Contracted Service City, Midwest and SkyWest shall mutually agree on the cost per turn (cycle) and Pass-Through Expenses that Midwest will pay for the Ground Handling Functions and <U>Exhibits&nbsp;5.03(b)</U> and <U>5.06</U> shall be amended to reflect the terms of such agreement. &nbsp;Midwest shall give as much notice as practicable of the designation of a SkyWest Service City or a Contracted Service City, but in no event will such notice be less than ninety (90) days unless mutually agreed.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994765"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.03</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Facilities</U></B>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Hub Cities</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest will sublease from Midwest airport facilities at the Hub Cities as set forth in mutually agreeable sublease agreements, at no expense to SkyWest. &nbsp;In the event SkyWest requires additional facilities at any of the Hub Cities caused by the expansion of Regional Airline Services, Midwest shall use its reasonable efforts to obtain such facilities and provide them to SkyWest at no charge to SkyWest. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest agree that Midwest may relocate SkyWest to comparable facilities at the Hub Cities, provided that Midwest pays SkyWest&#146;s reasonable relocation expenses.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Service Cities</U>. &nbsp;At Midwest Service Cities, Midwest shall provide SkyWest with the Ground Handling Functions pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.02, above, utilizing Midwest&#146;s owned and/or leased premises and equipment (including jetbridges where applicable) located thereon. &nbsp;Midwest shall cooperate with SkyWest&#146;s efforts to become a signatory carrier at such airports; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that if SkyWest becomes a signatory carrier at any such airport, SkyWest shall vote as directed by Midwest on any matters submitted to the signatory carriers for a vote. &nbsp;At SkyWest Service Cities, SkyWest shall be solely responsible for all of its facilities and equipment requirements; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, if Midwest owns and/or leases facilities at a SkyWest Service City and elects to provide Ground Handling Functions to SkyWest pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.02, Midwest shall p
rovide such services utilizing Midwest&#146;s owned and/or leased premises and equipment (including jetbridges where applicable) located thereon. At a Contracted Service City, SkyWest shall be solely responsible for all of its facilities and equipment requirements. &nbsp;In the event Midwest exercises its right, pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.02, to have a Midwest-designated contract agent perform the Ground Handling Functions in a Contracted </P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>12</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">Service City, Midwest shall be solely responsible for all facilities and equipment requirements. Midwest will determine in its sole discretion whether a jetbridge will be used at all Service Cities.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Maintenance Facilities</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest shall provide and be solely responsible for all maintenance facilities necessary to the provision of Regional Airline Services; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that Midwest shall provide a reasonable amount of its present Milwaukee hangar facilities for use by SkyWest, at no charge to SkyWest. &nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, Midwest may, upon one hundred twenty (120) days written notice to SkyWest, utilize any hangar space provided to SkyWest for any other purpose, and SkyWest shall make other arrangements as necessary. &nbsp;To the extent that SkyWest was utilizing Midwest&#146;s hangar facility in Milwaukee and is required to make other arrangements pursuant to this paragraph, Midwest and SkyWest shall mutually agree on an adjustment to the fixed costs in Section&nbsp;5.04.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Landing Fees</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest shall be responsible for payment of landing fees at all airports to which it provides Regional Airline Services pursuant to this Agreement and at all airports to which a Scheduled Flight, Non-Scheduled Flight or Charter Flight is diverted. &nbsp;The actual amount of landing fees paid by SkyWest shall constitute Pass-Through Expenses pursuant to <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.06</U>.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(e)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Signage</U>. &nbsp;Subject to Governmental Regulations, SkyWest shall display at all ticketing and check-in locations such signage or other forms of advertisement to identify and promote Midwest&#146;s service as Midwest may specify and as approved by the relevant airport authority. &nbsp;All signage utilizing the YX Identification shall be provided by Midwest at its sole cost, shall be the property of Midwest and shall be subject to the applicable provisions of Article VII, below. &nbsp;SkyWest shall not use the SkyWest Identification on any signage or other forms of advertisement used to identify or promote the Regional Airline Services (except as otherwise required by Governmental Regulations).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(f)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Facilities Lease Option</U>. &nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, Midwest may, at its option, elect to hold the leasehold interest in any facilities to be used by SkyWest at any new or existing Service City, and in the event Midwest exercises this option (i) Midwest shall enter into a facilities lease with the lessor of such facilities, (ii) SkyWest shall utilize such facilities pursuant to a sub-lease or facilities use agreement with Midwest, (iii) the rent/facilities charges payable by SkyWest in such sub-lease or facilities use agreement shall be the same as Midwest&#146;s Direct Cost under the Facilities Lease for the facilities used by SkyWest, (iv) the sub-lease or facilities use agreement shall terminate when SkyWest ceases to operate Regional Airline Services at the airport, and (v) Midwest shall lease facilities which are reasonably suitable for SkyWest&#146;s operati
onal needs and, with respect to new Service Cities, Midwest shall complete the leasing arrangements in a manner that will allow SkyWest adequate time to prepare to commence Regional Airline Services at the Service City as scheduled by Midwest.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994766"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.04</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Data Communications</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest shall provide to SkyWest at all Service Cities and Hub Cities, at Midwest&#146;s sole expense, data circuit lines, any required data networking equipment, the use of computer reservation terminals, printers and modems, including hardware, software and maintenance support for such equipment (the &#147;Data Communication Equipment&#148;). &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>13</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">Such Data Communication Equipment shall be of the same type and quality as that used by Midwest in its airline operations. &nbsp;In connection with the commencement of Regional Airline Services at a new Service City, Midwest will provide SkyWest with Midwest&#146;s standard Data Communication Equipment at Midwest&#146;s sole expense. &nbsp;In addition, Midwest shall provide SkyWest with access to Midwest&#146;s private SABRE partition during the term of this Agreement. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall enter into a separate written agreement with respect to the information technology services to be provided by Midwest to SkyWest in connection with the Regional Airline Services operated under this Agreement.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994767"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.05</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Reservation Services</U></B>. &nbsp;During the term of this Agreement, Midwest shall handle, at its sole expense, reservations for all passenger air transportation on Scheduled Flights operated by SkyWest pursuant to this Agreement. &nbsp;Reservations shall be handled in the same manner and subject to the same standards utilized by Midwest for its own reservations. &nbsp;All reservations shall be made in the name of Midwest unless otherwise required by Governmental Regulations. &nbsp;Midwest shall be sole owner of any customer or passenger data relating to the Scheduled Flights and related reservation services.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994768"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.06</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Ticketing Services and Ticketing Procedures</U></B>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Ticketing Services</U>. &nbsp;At all of its ticketing locations, Midwest shall, at its sole expense, sell, issue and exchange tickets for passenger air transportation on all Scheduled Flights to be operated pursuant to this Agreement utilizing Midwest ticket stock and all related accounting forms printed with the Midwest logo, name and format (&#147;Midwest Tickets&#148;). &nbsp;Midwest hereby appoints SkyWest as its agent, and SkyWest hereby agrees to act as Midwest&#146;s agent, at all SkyWest ticketing locations in connection with the sale and issuance of all passenger tickets by SkyWest and with the same duties owed to Midwest in that capacity as is customary in the industry between airlines. &nbsp;At all of its ticketing locations, SkyWest shall sell, issue and exchange Midwest Tickets for passenger air transportation on all Scheduled Flights to be operated pursuant to this Agreement and to be provid
ed by and over the routes of Midwest (collectively, &#147;Ticketing Services&#148;). &nbsp;Nothing in this Section&nbsp;4.06(a) shall be deemed to alter or conflict with the provisions of Section&nbsp;9.01 hereof. &nbsp;Air carriers and other agencies other than Midwest may also issue tickets for travel to be performed by SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Booking and Ticketing Procedures</U>. &nbsp;The procedures followed and standards applied by SkyWest in booking flights and performing the Ticketing Services shall conform in all material respects to Midwest&#146;s own tariffs, procedures and standards applicable to the booking of Midwest flights and the issuance of Midwest Tickets and to the collection and remittance of the proceeds of such sales. &nbsp;SkyWest employees booking flights and performing Ticketing Services shall adhere to Midwest&#146;s procedures and standards as shall be provided to SkyWest in writing. &nbsp;In accordance with Section&nbsp;8.02, below, SkyWest shall be responsible for collecting and shall pay to Midwest any Ticket Taxes and Fees required to be collected under applicable law on Tickets sold by SkyWest utilizing Midwest ticket stock.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Frequent Flyer Program</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest agrees to accept Midwest frequent flyer tickets and to provide transportation services pursuant to such tickets at no charge to Midwest. &nbsp;All travel under the frequent flyer program solely on SkyWest shall entitle a passenger to such credit as shall be equivalent to the credit offered on Midwest for comparable mileage segments. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>14</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">Midwest will provide such credit to members of its frequent flyer program who travel on SkyWest at no charge to SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Supplies</U>. &nbsp;Midwest shall, at its sole expense, provide an adequate supply of ticket office forms and specialized supplies (such as baggage tags, but excluding normal office supplies such as paper, stationery, envelopes, memo pads and the like) bearing the YX Identification for use by SkyWest subject to the applicable provisions of Article VII, below.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(e)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Ticketing Costs</U>. &nbsp;All travel agency commissions attributable to Scheduled Flights shall be Midwest&#146;s expense. &nbsp;Midwest shall pay all computer reservation system fees attributable to passengers on Scheduled Flights. &nbsp;In the event Governmental Regulations preclude the payment of these fees by Midwest and SkyWest then pays them, Midwest shall immediately begin paying SkyWest a &#147;traffic referral&#148; commission on a semi-monthly basis in an amount equal to such fees formerly paid by Midwest for SkyWest. &nbsp;Such commission shall be retroactive to the date on which such fees were no longer lawfully paid by Midwest and shall be included in the semi-monthly payments to be made by Midwest pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.02.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994769"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.07</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Baggage Handling Services</U></B>. &nbsp;&#147;Baggage Handling Services&#148; shall consist of the following:</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">At all Midwest Service Cities and Hub Cities, SkyWest and Midwest shall exchange and transfer baggage in accordance with procedures to be mutually agreed upon and generally utilized by the parties.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">The procedures utilized in performing such Baggage Handling Services shall conform in all respects to Midwest&#146;s own standards and procedures as adapted to SkyWest&#146;s Aircraft and operations.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">For purposes of baggage claims, SkyWest will be treated as if it were a party to standard industry ticketing and baggage agreements with Midwest and other air carriers. &nbsp;SkyWest will make available at the request of any passenger excess valuation insurance, if any, offered by Midwest to the extent such insurance covers SkyWest&#146;s flights and Midwest&#146;s flights.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994770"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.08</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Air Cargo Handling Services</U></B>. &nbsp;&#147;Air Cargo Handling Services&#148; shall consist of the following:</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">At each location at which Midwest operates Ticketing Services, Midwest shall at no charge to SkyWest accept Air Cargo for shipment on flights to be operated by and over the routes of SkyWest or Midwest. Midwest shall issue air waybills covering Air Cargo and shall prepare a &#147;transfer manifest&#148; for each SkyWest flight on which there shall be an Air Cargo shipment which transfer manifest shall set forth all Air Cargo to be carried on the flight.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">Midwest hereby appoints SkyWest as its agent, and SkyWest hereby agrees to act as Midwest&#146;s agent, at all SkyWest ticketing locations in connection with the sale and issuance of all air waybills by SkyWest and with the same duties owed to Midwest in that capacity as is customary in the industry between airlines. &nbsp;SkyWest agrees to observe all Midwest procedures and standards applicable to the issuance of air waybills and to the collection and remittance of the proceeds of such sales. &nbsp;SkyWest employees performing such duties shall adhere to </P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>15</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">Midwest&#146;s procedures and standards as shall be provided to SkyWest in writing. &nbsp;In accordance with Section&nbsp;8.02, below, SkyWest shall be responsible for collecting and shall pay to Midwest any Ticket Taxes and Fees required to be collected under applicable law on air waybills sold by SkyWest utilizing Midwest air waybills. &nbsp;Nothing in this Section&nbsp;4.08(b) shall be deemed to alter or conflict with the provisions of Section&nbsp;9.01 hereof. &nbsp;Air carriers other than Midwest may also issue air waybills for cargo transportation to be performed by SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">SkyWest shall provide Air Cargo Handling Services at SkyWest&#146;s ticketing locations for and on behalf of Midwest for Air Cargo carried solely on SkyWest or on both a SkyWest flight and a Midwest flight. &nbsp;Such handling services shall be performed in accordance with Midwest&#146;s procedures and standards as provided to SkyWest in writing, including but not limited to (i) accepting all Air Cargo that Midwest accepts, such as pets/AVI (other live animals), human remains, Priority Service (SPC) freight and perishables, and U.S. Mail, unless otherwise mutually agreed, and (ii) keeping facilities open at least one and one-half (1.5) hours before and one (1) hour after each Scheduled Flight for customers to deliver and pick up Air Cargo.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(d)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">For Air Cargo carried solely on SkyWest or on both an SkyWest flight and a Midwest flight, SkyWest and Midwest shall charge rates in accordance with Midwest&#146;s applicable rates and tariffs; such revenues shall be paid 100% to and retained by Midwest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(e)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">For purposes of Air Cargo claims, SkyWest will be treated as if it were a party to standard industry ticketing and baggage agreements with Midwest and other air carriers.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(f)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">Midwest shall, at its sole expense, supply SkyWest with all necessary Air Cargo forms and supplies in an agreed upon form with the YX Identification, subject to the applicable provisions of Article VII, below. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall utilize such forms and supplies when accepting Air Cargo for transport on SkyWest&#146;s flights.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994771"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.09</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Use of COMAT</U></B>. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall each provide to the other, at no cost to the other and on a non-discriminatory basis, access to its respective COMAT system for the movement and acquisition of priority aircraft maintenance parts and other company material. &nbsp;Midwest&#146;s failure to deliver timely a maintenance component via COMAT, whether timely or at all, shall not cause an affected Scheduled Flight to be excluded in calculating SkyWest&#146;s on-time performance and completion factors. &nbsp;All access shall be consistent with Midwest&#146;s and SkyWest&#146;s respective published COMAT procedures and policies, as amended from time to time. &nbsp;Midwest shall provide to SkyWest at no cost and on a non-discriminatory basis, access to Midwest&#146;s VIP express cargo service to the extent necessary for Aircraft out of service recovery.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994772"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>4.10</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Slots and Route Authorities</U></B>. &nbsp;During the term of this Agreement (including any Renewal Terms) or upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, Midwest may, in its sole discretion, require SkyWest to transfer to Midwest or its designee at no charge any airport takeoff or landing slots, route authorities or other regulatory authorities as Midwest shall designate which have been or are being used for Regional Airlines Services under this Agreement.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994773"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>16</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always"><B>4.11</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Emergency Response and Family Assistanc</U>e</B>. &nbsp;Midwest and SkyWest shall enter into a separate written agreement with respect to emergency response and family assistance services to be provided to SkyWest by Midwest at no charge in connection with the Regional Airlines Services operated under this Agreement.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; font-size:16px" align=center><B>ARTICLE V<BR>
<BR>
<A NAME="_Toc159994774"></A>REVENUES, PAYMENTS AND SETOFF</B></P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994775"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>5.01</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Revenues</U></B>. &nbsp;SkyWest acknowledges and agrees that all revenues resulting from the sale and issuance of passenger tickets and cargo air waybills associated with the operation of the Aircraft and all other sources of revenue associated with the operation of the Aircraft are the sole property of Midwest, including without limitation ticket change fees and other fees or charges which are applicable pursuant to Midwest&#146;s tariffs, unaccompanied minor fees, beverage and buy-on-board food services, excess baggage fees and nonrevenue pass travel charges.</P>
<A NAME="_Toc159994776"></A><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px"><B>5.02</B></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><B><U>Payments to SkyWest</U></B>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(a)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Reports</U>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Block Hours; Cycles</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest shall provide to Midwest periodic reports with respect to the number of actual, completed (A) Block Hours and (B) Cycles, of regional jet service flown by SkyWest (each in respect of Scheduled Flights, Charter Flights and Non-Scheduled Flights) in accordance with the following schedule in each calendar month during the term of this Agreement:</P>

</TD><TD valign=top width=240><P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center><B>[*]</B></P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>A/C Months</U>. &nbsp;SkyWest shall also provide Midwest periodic reports with respect to its A/C Months in accordance with the following schedule in each calendar month during the term of this Agreement:</P>
<TABLE style="font-size:13.333px" cellspacing=0><TR><TD width=96></TD><TD width=276></TD><TD width=240></TD></TR>

</TD></TR>

<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(iii)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Pass-Through Expenses</U>.<B> &nbsp;</B>SkyWest shall also provide Midwest periodic reports with respect to its Pass-Through Expenses in accordance with the following schedule in each calendar month during the term of this Agreement:</P>
<TABLE style="font-size:13.333px" cellspacing=0><TR><TD width=96></TD><TD width=276></TD><TD width=240></TD></TR>

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>17</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">(b)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Payment Schedule</U>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Provisional Block Hour, Cycle, Fixed Cost and Monthly Margin Payments</U>. &nbsp;On Monday of each week during the term of this Agreement, Midwest shall remit to SkyWest by wire transfer of immediately available funds, as provisional payments in arrears for the prior week, (A) the Provisional Block Hour Payment, (B) the Provisional Cycle Payment, (C) the Provisional Fixed Cost Payment and (D) the Provisional Monthly Margin Payment.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Final Block Hour, Cycle, Fixed Cost and Monthly Margin Payments</U>. &nbsp;Midwest shall remit to SkyWest by wire transfer of immediately available funds by the close of business on the 15th day of each calendar month (or the next banking day if the 15th is a bank holiday), as final payments, (A) the Final Block Hour Payment, (B) the Final Cycle Payment, (C) the Final Fixed Cost Payment, and (D) the Final Monthly Margin Payment, for the month covered by the Block Hour Report, the Cycle Report and the A/C Months Report furnished by SkyWest pursuant to Sections 5.02(a)(i) and (ii), above, less the aggregate amount of the Provisional Block Hour Payments, Provisional Cycle Payments, Provisional Fixed Cost Payments and Provisional Monthly Margin Payments made by Midwest pursuant to Section 5.02(b)(i), above, which are attributable to the preceding month, adjusted on a pro-rata basis to accou
nt for any provisional payments which cover less than seven (7) days in such week. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(iii)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Final Pass-Through Expense and IOP Payments</U>. &nbsp;Midwest shall remit to SkyWest by wire transfer of immediately available funds by the close of business on the 30<SUP>th</SUP> day of each calendar month (or the next banking day if the 30<SUP>th</SUP> is a bank holiday), as final payments, (A) the Pass-Through Expense Payment, and (B) the IOP Payment, if any, for the month covered by the Pass-Through Expense Report furnished by SkyWest pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.02(a)(iii).</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(c)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Payment Calculations</U>. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(i)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Provisional Payments</U>. &nbsp;The provisional payments to be made to SkyWest pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.02(b)(i), above, shall be calculated as follows for the applicable period:</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(A)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">Each Provisional Block Hour Payment will be equal to the amount set forth on <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.02(c)(i)</U>, as such amount may be changed from time to time during the term of this Agreement by mutual agreement of Midwest and SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(B)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">Each Provisional Cycle Payment will be equal to the amount set forth on <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.02(c)(i)</U>, as such amount may be changed from time to time during the term of this Agreement by mutual agreement of Midwest and SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(C)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">Each Provisional Fixed Cost Payment will be equal to the amount set forth on <U>Exhibit&nbsp;5.02(c)(i)</U>, as such amount may be changed from time to time during the term of this Agreement by mutual agreement of Midwest and SkyWest.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(D)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">Each Provisional Monthly Margin Payment will be equal to <B>[*]</B>.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin:0px; font-size:16px" align=center>18</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px; page-break-before:always">(ii)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px"><U>Final Block Hour, Cycle, Fixed Cost and Monthly Margin Payments</U>. &nbsp;The final payments to be made to SkyWest pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.02(b)(ii), above, shall be calculated as follows for the applicable month:</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(A)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">The Final Block Hour Payment will be equal to the sum of the results of the following calculation for each Block Hour Cost Element: &nbsp;the applicable Block Hour Rate for each Block Hour Cost Element shall be multiplied by the number of actual, completed Block Hours reported in the Block Hour Report for such month for Scheduled Flights, Non-Scheduled Flights and Charter Flights.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(B)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">The Final Cycle Payment will be equal to the sum of the results of the following calculation for each Cycle Cost Element: &nbsp;the applicable Cycle Rate for each Cycle Cost Element shall be multiplied by the number of actual, completed Cycles reported in the Cycle Report for such month for Scheduled Flights and Non-Scheduled Flights.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(C)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">The Final Fixed Cost Payment will be equal to the sum of the results of the following calculation for each Fixed Cost Element: &nbsp;the applicable Fixed Cost Rate for each Fixed Cost Element shall be multiplied by the number of A/C Months in the A/C Months Report for such month.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(D)</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:16px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:96px; font-size:16px">The Final Monthly Margin Payment will be equal to <B>[*]</B>.</P>
<P style="line-height:18.667px; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-18.667px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:48px; font-size:16px">(iii)</P>
